text.0: great art thou indra yea the earth with gladness and heaven confess to thee thine high dominion.
text.1: thou in thy vigour having slaughtered vṛtra didst free the floods arrested by the dragon.
text.2: heaven trembled at the birth of thine effulgence earth trembled at the fear of thy displeasure.
text.3: the stedfast mountains shook in agitation  the waters flowed and desert spots were flooded.
text.4: hurling his bolt with might he cleft the mountain while putting forth his strength he showed his vigour.
text.5: he slaughtered vṛtra with his bolt exulting and their lord slain forth flowed the waters swiftly.
text.6: thy father dyaus esteemed himself a hero most noble was the work of indras maker.
text.7: his who begat the strong bolts lord who roareth immovable like earth from her foundation.
text.8: he who alone oerthrows the world of creatures indra the peoples king invoked of many.
text.9: verily all rejoice in him extolling the boons which maghavan the god hath sent them.
text.10: all soma juices are his own for ever most gladdening draughts are ever his the mighty.
text.11: thou ever wast the treasurelord of treasures indra thou lettest all folk share thy bounty.
text.12: moreover when thou first wast born o indra thou struckest terror into all the people.
text.13: thou maghavan rentest with thy bolt the dragon who lay against the waterfloods of heaven.
text.14: the everslaying bold and furious indra the bright bolts lord infinite strong and mighty.
text.15: who slayeth vṛtra and acquireth booty giver of blessings maghavan the bounteous.
text.16: alone renowned as maghavan in battles he frighteneth away assembled armies.
text.17: he bringeth us the booty that he winneth may we wellloved continue in his friendship.
text.18: renowned is he when conquering and when slaying fis he who winneth cattle in the combat.
text.19: when indra hardeneth his indignation all that is fixed and all that moveth fear him.
text.20: indra hath won all kine all gold all horsesmaghavan he who breaketh forts in pieces.
text.21: most manly with these men of his who help him dealing out wealth and gathering the treasure.
text.22: what is the care of indra for his mother what cares he for the father who begat him.
text.23: his care is that which speeds his might in conflicts like wind borne onward by the clouds that thunder.
text.24: maghavan makes the settled man unsettled he scatters dust that he hath swept together.
text.25: breaking in pieces like heaven armed with lightning maghavan shall enrich the man who lauds hm.
text.26: he urged the chariotwheel of sūrya forward etaśa speeding on his way he rested.
text.27: him the black undulating cloud bedeweth in this midairs depth at the base of darkness.
text.28: as in the night the sacrificing priest.
text.29: eager for booty craving strength and horses wesingers stir indra the strong for friendship.
text.30: who gives the wives we seek whose succour fails not to hasten like a pitcher to the fountain.
text.31: be thou our guardian show thyself our kinsman watching and blessing those who pour the soma.
text.32: as friend as sire most fatherly of fathers giving the suppliant vital strength and freedom.
text.33: be helping friend of those who seek thy friendship  give life when lauded indra to the singer.
text.34: for indra we the priests have paid thee worship exalting thee with these our sacrifices.
text.35: alone when indra maghavan is lauded he slayeth many neerresisted vṛtras.
text.36: him in whose keeping is the wellloved singer never do gods or mortals stay or hinder.
text.37: een so let maghavan the loudvoiced indra give us true blessings foeless mens upholder.
text.38: king of all creatures give us glory amply exalted glory due to him who lauds thee.
text.39: now indra lauded glorified with praises let power swell high like rivers for the singer.
text.40: for thee a new hymn lord of bays is fashioned may we carborne through song be victors ever.
